alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 1:25AM CDT until May 09 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Port Of Brownsville, Laureles, Cameron Park, Olmito, Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, La Paloma, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Laguna Vista Police Department, Holly Beach, Los Fresnos High School, Los Fresnos City Offices, Lopez - Riggins Elementary School, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Rivera High School and Rancho Verde Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
